About Mechanical Engineering

Mechanical Engineering is the discipline that applies engineering, physics, and material science principles to design, analyze, manufacture, and maintain mechanical systems. Learn more on Google

Thermodynamics

Key Concepts

  • First Law of Thermodynamics: Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transferred or changed in form. Learn more on Google
  • Second Law of Thermodynamics: Entropy of any isolated system always increases. Learn more on Google
  • Thermodynamic Cycles: Carnot cycle, Rankine cycle, Otto cycle, etc. Learn more on Google

Thermodynamics plays a crucial role in understanding heat engines, refrigerators, and HVAC systems.

Fluid Mechanics

Key Concepts

  • Bernoulliâ€™s Principle: As the speed of a fluid increases, its pressure decreases. Learn more on Google
  • Navier-Stokes Equations: Describes the motion of viscous fluid substances. Learn more on Google
  • Reynolds Number: Determines whether flow is laminar or turbulent. Learn more on Google

Fluid Mechanics is essential in designing hydraulic systems, aerospace applications, and predicting weather patterns.

Manufacturing Processes

Key Concepts

  • Machining: Processes like milling, drilling, and turning. Learn more on Google
  • Casting: Pouring molten material into a mold to create a part. Learn more on Google
  • Welding: Joining materials, usually metals or thermoplastics. Learn more on Google
  • 3D Printing: Additive manufacturing technology to build parts layer by layer. Learn more on Google

Manufacturing processes are fundamental to building everything from microchips to automobiles.
